definition: the Qing court (as government of China)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
palace courtyard

sentences.english: Ching court began to feel its rule threatened.
sentences.chinese: 清廷开始感到自己的统治受到了威胁。

sentences.english: Postwar, Hannekon was promoted to General and made consultant to the Beiyang Navy.
sentences.chinese: 战后清廷授升其为将军兼北洋海军总部顾问。

sentences.english: More than one hundred old fogies migrated to Qingdao occupied by Genmany after the Qing Dynasty's abdication.
sentences.chinese: 清廷逊位后，一百多名遗老客居德人占据的青岛。

sentences.english: Historians have emphasized the conservatism of the Qing court.
sentences.chinese: 历史学家已注意到清廷的保守立场。

sentences.english: Is also say, Manchu Court to wood then slowly of the memorial haven't made a reaction.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，清廷对林则徐的奏折尚未作出反应。

sentences.english: Debarred from the Country, unable to have students in the college or girls, In the school.
sentences.chinese: 由于清廷的禁止，我们无法替学院招募到学生或女孩。

sentences.english: The Manchu Court equally has no time to respond.
sentences.chinese: 清廷同样没有时间反应。

sentences.english: The right to be loved without having to earn it.
sentences.chinese: 即使不引人注目也有被清廷的权利。

sentences.english: The qing dynasty navy often war often hurt, decided to rally the pirates.
sentences.chinese: 清廷水师屡战屡败，决定重整旗鼓收拾海盗。

sentences.english: Last, the ban policy of population contradicted the policy of lifting the ban of population.
sentences.chinese: 最后，清廷对蒙地人口封禁政策与其弛禁政策相矛盾。

sentences.english: The transportation efficiency of Manchu Court comprehension report, also not equal to river's lake.
sentences.chinese: 清廷情报的传送效率，还不如江湖。

definition: Qing government (1644-1911)
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Great Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Zuo Zongtang (1812-1885), Chinese administrator and military leader
Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing
the Qing dynasty equivalent of the Foreign Office
Taiping Heavenly Kingdom (1851-1864)
court/imperial household/dynasty
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
the Qing army
reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)
Wu Sangui (1612-1678), Chinese general who let the Manchus into China and helped them establish the Qing Dynasty, later leading a revolt against Qing in an effort to start his own dynasty
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
